texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And this is?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The Globe theater! I read this was the theater where Shakespeare's troupe performed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.
I see her research on Shakespeare for her next novel is going well.
I approach her and bring my face closer to Olivia.
The scent of roses tickles my nose as I breathe in.

texts.name: Olivia (Yonagi)
texts.text: Has a nice scent to it, does it not? That's the scent of roses.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, it's captivating.

texts.name: Olivia (Yonagi)
texts.text: Now, don't sniff if you know what's good for you.
I take a few steps back.
The scent of roses weakens accordingly.
There's nothing strange about the way the scent disperses.
This is a big breakthrough.
We were able to reproduce the dispersion of scent particles according to the laws of physics.
Everything's going as I theorized so far.
I thought we might experience a delay due to the processing calculations, but there's been no lag I can detect.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Earth to Kaito! What do you think?
Her voice sounds as it should at this distance.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm, it seems fine. I believe it's going well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ooh!
This dreamscape has both Yonagi's and my thoughts in it, so I've come to call it a compound dreamscape.
It's no longer a world shaped after Yonagi's cognition and thoughts alone.
While she is the one building this world, the data is sent to and managed by Wooleep.
Yonagi and I are participants in the dream, and we communicate with each other and the world through Wooleep.
Yonagi definitely created the world itself on her own, but now it's being shared in equal measure to all the participants connected to Wooleep.
If I were to draw a conceptual diagram, the only difference now is that Wooleep is acting as a middleman between us, but it changes quite a lot.
The biggest change of them all is the fact that Wooleep is accumulating the raw data of the world Yonagi is building up.
If we develop the data from her dreamscape even further, maybe it could help to solve the problems that the professor's lab is facing right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is a big step forward. Maybe it could produce something that the professor was never able to.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, project the data from that session onto the monitor.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Displaying now.
Izumo broadcasts her data to the terminal in my hand.
It's a record of our sensory information while in the dreamscape.
Wooleep is equipped with the sensory feedback manipulation app provided by the professor, and he's able to transfer data back to Izumo.
The information displayed shows a staggering amount of detailed information compared to the bio monitoring function that Izumo's equipped with.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's amazing. We can see exactly which actions stimulate which parts of the brain. It's literally all here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Think it could be useful?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. At the very least it's a huge step in the right direction.
I learn several things from analyzing the data.
About both Yonagi's dreamscape and the professor's virtual space.
There is only one difference between the experience of the participants: the stimulus of the sense of smell.
And yet...
The parts of the brain being stimulated are completely different in both.
When I'm inside Yonagi's dreamscape, it's not only my thalamus being stimulated, but every single part of my limbic system.
Moreover, which parts of it are reacting varies wildly depending on the situation.

To put it simply, while the motor commands produced by the brain are not being transmitted to the muscles through the brain stem, the brain still behaves as if the body were actually moving in reality.
But at the same time...
Those neurological reactions change depending on the person's psychological state.
For example, the parts of my brain reacting were different when I was in the theater, facing Yonagi, or making sure the scents worked as intended.
The curiousness of exploring an unfamiliar place, talking, and reacting to what I see. All of these stimulate different areas of the brain.
This means that the state of mind and cognition of each participant will become the parameters needed for the construction of the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Which means...
Does this mean we have to separately tune the stimulus signals that the dreamscape sends to each brain depending on the person?
That can't be.
It would take several lifetimes to do such a thing on a large scale.
If more participants are added to the mix, communication between them will also occur.
Not to mention states of semi-communication in which a person reaches towards another and waits for an answer.
The depth of human interaction is not a mere binary concept. It's something that's always in flux.
Each action makes the brain react a certain way, and not everyone reacts to the same stimuli the same way.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a whole different beast...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Did something go wrong?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your dreamscape and the professor's virtual space are very similar, but... Now I understand that they're completely different on the inside.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Your dreamscape is a hundred—no, thousands of times more complicated.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: At the very least, I can't even tell how many brain process patterns there are or how they all relate to each other just yet.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So I'm the best, then? Good to know!
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think we should be happy about it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This means that it's impossible to build the lab's vision of a virtual space, at least for the time being.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What? It's that different?
I nod, my eyes still scanning the information feed on the monitor.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What are you gonna do? Is there anything I can do to help?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Of course. You can help a lot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Since we're dealing with this degree of complexity...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We have no choice but to gather statistical data and emulate it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll accumulate the sensory data of our brains by experiencing a variety of places, experiences, and situations in the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Once we have enough data, we can generate brain reaction signals based on statistical predictions.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: To put it simply, we'll need to collect enough data between the two of us to produce a Yonagi emulator, if you will.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: An emulator?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm just making a machine imitate the processes your brain performs when building this space.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So the goal will be to experience as many kinds of spaces, sounds, and emotions as possible in the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll talk about different things, go to different places—the more variation we can produce, the better. Same goes for the emotions.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So that means I should put you in as many situations as possible and show you as many characters as I can to get different emotions out of you?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's one way to put it, yeah.
Her eyes widen and start to glitter as an impish smile plays about her lips.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good for you, because stories is what I'm best at! I got tons of them! Let's get started!

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Peaching peaches Sumomo Momonouchi!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa, long time no see, Sumomo.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Been a while, eh, Kanna?
I can't help but smile at the nostalgic sight.
We're in Momonouchi Sumomo and Amei Kanna's summer love story.
It's from the time when Yonagi and I started living together.
It's the first story she ever completed, back when we were kids.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, right. This was the story where they went out to look for the place in his mom's photo, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep! I wanted to make a story like The Blue Bird back then, remember?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Heh.
I notice something new about Sumomo and chuckle to myself.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What is it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Isn't it a bit much?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you mean?
I recognize the smell from the batch of printed samples I showed her the other day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That sweet scent is peaches, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? I smell like peaches? Really?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a little on the nose.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hah! How rude! You're gonna have to look for another gal to help you if you keep that up!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry, my bad.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So what now? We take a walk or something?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, we can walk around.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So we just hang around? That's it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's enough. You're creating worlds indistinguishable from reality with nothing but your own mind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is more than remarkable enough, I'm sure.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we can reproduce this with a machine, I'm not exaggerating when I say that it will save humankind.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wew! You'll become super famous when you build that doohickey, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait, what? Don't bring me into it!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's fine. Just say you came up with everything.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know? I'm so happy we can finally talk to each other.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? Don't we talk all the time?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, but Sumomo's partner is Kanna, and Olivia's is Will... But they're all modeled after you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: They're not literally you, but I guess it's kind of hard for the characters you make to not come out looking like the people close to you.
We keep walking along to the airport fence.
Each step is punctuated by the sound of crunching gravel beneath our feet.
I look up at the blue sky, feeling the occasional soft, warm caress of the wind against my face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey, can we go to England next? I came up with something super cool!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You know Romeo and Juliet, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You've been telling me that story ever since we were kids, so it'd be hard not to.
The tragic story of two youths from families embroiled in a generational feud who fall in love, but ultimately die for it.
Ever since she first told me about it, I always wondered if there could have been a better ending for them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Since it's the most famous story in the whole world, I'm making a story about Shakespeare and how he got to the point where he wrote it!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sounds really good, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It does sound interesting, but it also sounds like something that's been made a thousand times before.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's because it's such a good trope! Now hear this! Did you know that the name Olivia is something that Shakespeare came up with?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really!

texts.name: Olivia (Yonagi)
texts.text: A beauty that mesmerizes through the ages. The greatest poet of all time is the one who spun the name.

texts.name: Olivia (Yonagi)
texts.text: It's perfect, is it not? You could even say that there is no other name more befitting for the world's first actress.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right. Women couldn't act back then, yeah?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Bingo!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You mind if I switch characters on the fly like this?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Not at all. It doesn't even have to be Chiba in 2060 or England in the sixteenth century. Show me anything you want.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Keep going. Show me something that'll jolt my brain good.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now, that's the fire I wanted to see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You have more characters than Sumomo and Olivia, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I got boatloads! You remember the female detective Rebecca? I also have a really fun story about a super female hacker named Haruka Motomiya! And that's not all—
Those don't sound very interesting.
But she's really pumped up about them, so I guess I'll go along with it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: *Sigh*
I was writing code for a basic emulator all night yesterday.
Using the data produced by me and Yonagi as a sample, I'm correcting any issues in the simulation with statistical processing.
Thankfully, my memory comes in handy once more.
I find and assess each difference between the virtual space and Yonagi's composite dreamscape, and attempt to close the gap with programming.
It's only because of my perfect memory that I'm able to contrast what the feed shows me with the discrepancies in visual and auditory feedback that I experienced in the dreamscape.
But no matter how good my memory is, I still only have as many hours in a day as anyone else. Needless to say, my sleep schedule is in shambles.
Hey there!
I turn around at the sound of a familiar voice.
Iruma is walking up to me, his expression as jovial as I remember it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Been a while.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You been well?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well enough. Just a little sleep deprived.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You say that as if it isn't business as usual for you.
He has a laugh at my expense as he comes to stand next to me and leans on the railing to overlook the city.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: So, yeah...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I'm a researcher now. Starting today.
For a moment, the news cast a dark shadow over me.
I couldn't return the words.
So Iruma's already a researcher while I haven't achieved anything in Professor Asuma's lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's amazing. Congrats.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Nah, man. I haven't done a thing, really.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I mean, I'm pretty much a glorified assistant, I guess? I don't know jack about the research, I just measure and divide medicine all day as I'm instructed.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Hard to feel good about getting called a researcher like that, to be honest.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They're doing important work over at Kanou's lab, and you're part of that.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: I still don't feel good about it. If I knew this is how things were gonna go down, I would've chosen a smaller lab where I'd actually get to do something.
The grass is always greener on the other side, huh?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: How is it going for you? You feeling more fulfilled over at Asuma's lab?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think so. Right now we're researching something that would overhaul the whole approach his lab has taken towards its research so far.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Whoa.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose it is, but to be honest...
I idly look out over the middle side cityscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm still a lowsider. I'm happy to hear that you finally became a researcher.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I mean, you were a midsider anyway, but you know what I mean.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Aw, don't give me that. We both know you're the better man here. Heck, our whole class knows that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think so. You get along with everyone, and I can't brighten up the mood like you can. Not in a thousand years.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think big laboratories need people like you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Kanou's lab is like a big family, right? I'm sure they appreciate someone who can talk to people.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Well, if you think so highly of me, why not poach me away?
I turn to face Iruma, and I'm met with his placid smile.
I realize immediately that he's not trying to mess with me.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: No need to hurry, my man. I just know you'll be carrying that lab on your shoulders in no time flat.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You really think so?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You might have had a hard time noticing with your nose stuck in all those books, but you really stood out back in the engineering course.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Everyone always had you pegged for the kind of guy that finds his own research topic and gets a laboratory named after them.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: You know, the day I met you I resolved to turn my life around and go through with all this.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I never knew. Is that what you were thinking?

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: There's no man more fit for the post than you. Work hard, my boy. I'll be looking forward to hearing the good news.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Make sure I'm at the top of the list when the Kaito lab opens up. I'll scout out all the best assistants from the other labs, just for you.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Like you said, I'm getting a good head start on that already, heh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's good to know someone has my back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All right. If I ever get my own lab, I'll ask you to become my second in command.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Wahoo! Don't go forgetting about me when you make it big, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My memory's the only thing I have going for me. I promise I won't forget.
We look up at the lens above us. The sun is still high in the sky.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Well, I guess it's time for me to go measure out medicine for the day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And time for me to bang my head against the wall a few times.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll use this jealousy over seeing my peers climb up the ladder to see if I can get some work done.

texts.name: Iruma
texts.text: Hahah! If I could make you even slightly green with envy, I suppose becoming a researcher was worth something.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You look a little tired, Kaito.
Towards evening, Professor Asuma suddenly appears in the lab as I'm resting my elbow on the table and my head in my hand.
Whoops. I was on the verge of falling asleep.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sorry, I was up late last night.
He nods, his smile showing a tacit understanding.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Were you giving a lecture today?
He shakes his head.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Just a regular meeting of laboratory directors. The quarterly one to keep track of all the labs of the institute and their progress.
There's nothing for our lab to report yet.
I've no idea how big of a meeting it was, but just imagining how he must have felt makes my chest twinge painfully.
We can't continue like this.
If we don't get results soon, the lab will slowly die off.
Just a little more...
If I can improve the emulator, I'll be able to show it to him.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You've been busy as of late, haven't you? I can always tell when a researcher is working on something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes, I'm making a prototype to test a hypothesis I have.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Ohoh.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm exploring a method that doesn't involve manipulating the thalamus.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Basically, I'm trying to verify if we could create a virtual space in a different way to what we're doing now.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But it's still just a hypothesis, so I'll wait until I have something concrete to show.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'll be waiting with bated breath.
The professor says, before pacing over to the brewing machine to serve us two cups of coffee.
He doesn't seem exhausted or impatient.
Guess it goes to show how different I still am from a seasoned career researcher.
I'll show that I can produce greater results than any of the others who started working in other labs.
Research is a long-term affair. There's no need to rush.
Or so I tell myself, but I can't deny the growing frustration churning in my chest with every passing day.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's up?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, it's just...
I raise my face from the terminal and give a limpless reply.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you having trouble with that, uh, emulator thing?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, it's going well enough... But I guess I am having trouble. Or rather, I've encountered a problem.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In physics, there's something called the n-body problem.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The what problem?
I look up to see Yonagi cocking her head to the side in confusion.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Basically, it's impossible to predict the motion of three or more bodies that influence each other.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um, okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let me give you an example. If you and I were the only people in the world, it would be relatively easy to simulate our state of mind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As members of the opposite gender, we would grow to love one another if that were our inclination, which it is in this case. For example, we would feel calm holding hands or being together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: To put it simply, it would be easy to predict how two entities interacting with each other would behave.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Y-Yeah, way to say that with a straight face...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Err, worry not. Do continue, good sir.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But if we were to add an acquaintance of us both, like Professor Asuma, to the mix, our behavior would change again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm, I suppose?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The simulator I'm making processes the virtual space using data that comes from measuring the reactions of our brains under various stimuli.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But the way people interact becomes more complex when it comes to three or more people, so there's a limit to what we can accomplish with just the two of us?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's the gist of it, pretty much.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think 'complex' really covers just how complicated the process becomes with three people. Not that I can verify that with the data we can produce at the moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Then why don't we have Izumo join us?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She can't?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, uh... I don't know. Can she?
I didn't even consider a non-human participant.
But if I'm taking data from Yonagi, and she recognizes Izumo as an individual, it shouldn't pose a problem... Right?
In the future we'll need to prepare other human participants to collect data, though.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She can't enter my dreamscape or whatever?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can't say I ever thought of the possibility before.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Currently, the master data of the dreamscape that Yonagi creates is uploaded to Wooleep.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Your cognition is then turned into data and placed into the dreamscape as an avatar, which reacts with the dreamscape and sends sensory feedback in recognizable signals to your brains.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: As Wooleep is my assigned auxiliary terminal, I possess root administrator rights. It is possible to create new avatars in my image and send those signals to you in a way that you can perceive inside the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Er, so?! Would anyone mind translating into English for me?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It means that Izumo can enter the dreamscape, in short.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She also says that we can create as many participants into the dreamscape as her processing power allows.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She can be more than one person in there?!
I nod, still mulling over the implications of this discovery.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well, we should try and see how it works out. Can you enter the dreamscape now?
She gives one short nod for an answer.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's hang in Sumomo's world today!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, it's Izumo! She's here!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's amazing. It feels just like the real thing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She does look a little out of place in the garage with all those glowing lights and stuff though.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I can change my form.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh! Then I've got a great idea!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So, about this tall, and then make the boobies huge... Yes, that's good... And she's all touchy about her name and stuff. She goes... *whisper*

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What are you two doing over there?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm directing her on how to play her character.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hah.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Understood. I will perform it now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Break a leg!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: The name's Azuki, you squirt!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Azuki?

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Geez, did you forget Azuki, the greatest scrap hunter that ever lived?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, right!
She's from Sumomo's story.
There was a female scrap hunter character in it.
I still don't quite understand what a scrap hunter is supposed to be, though.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: I'm loving it! You got her just right! Well done!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Of course I did! Your girl can do anything she sets her mind to!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is that really Izumo speaking?

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Who else could it be, eh?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: S-Sorry...
That's what the woman named Azuki called herself.
There is no doubt that this is basically Izumo.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Ahahah! Yes, just like that! So I'm Sumomo, and Kaito is Kanna.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? Whoa!
I jump as I see myself shrink a few centimeters.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Don't get spooked now, boy! That's what we're here for—gathering data on as many scenarios as possible!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: This is what statistics are all about, I say!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Point taken.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: So, what do we do now? What kind of data do you want anyway, Candy?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Excuse me?

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: I mean, look at that little sweet face of yours. You're an eye candy if I've ever seen one.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: For real?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Isn't this one of your ideas, Yonagi?!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: I'm improvising!

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: You're hitting it out of the park! Me next! Give me a nickname!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Uhhh... You are... bitchy peaches!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who're you calling a bitch?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: H-Huh? We're out?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo! Is that what you've been thinking of me all these years?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm a virgin, I'll have you know! For now!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: There is no ulterior motive behind my words.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Then how did you come up with that nickname?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I simply predicted the most likely nickname by analyzing frequent vocabulary patterns from Azuki's personal data.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Then I chose a nickname that would suit Sumomo's personal data.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sumomo's a free soul who follows her own heart, but that doesn't make her a bitch!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know she has experience with men and stuff, but that doesn't mean she's a bitch or a slut or whatever!
Izumo nods back.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Do you get it now?!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: You bitches always have the same story.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: Izumo?!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: The name's Azuki!

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: At least just call me 'peach'!

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Sure thing, lady peach.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is impressive, Izumo.

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: I don't know what the heck happened to her!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: This is exactly the data I needed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Now we have data of you two interacting while I observe.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Yeah, all thanks to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see...
If we combine Wooleep's physics creation and Izumo's avatar creation function, we can greatly expand the scope of the dreamscape.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's try building the Yonagi emulator into Wooleep's OS. That way Izumo can participate as an avatar anytime she wants.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we can emulate you controlling three avatars, it should be easy to expand from there.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: Bet you're happy to have a genius like me on board, eh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You don't even know.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: For a woman who can't make anything but porridge, I sure have my uses, eh?

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: So you're conscious of that, huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's okay, Azuki. Your porridge is the best ever. We love eating it every day, for real.

texts.name: Azuki (Izumo)
texts.text: I'm not Izumo! My damn name's Azuki!

texts.name: Sumomo (Yonagi)
texts.text: She's a consummate actress, huh? She really gets in the role.
We both glance at Izumo, who has her back to us as she industriously does the usual chores.
She's sweeping the floor, her expression as neutral as it's ever been.
Never before has her lack of expression seemed more enigmatic than now.
But none of us can deny that she's just her usual self.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm floored.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Same here.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's nothing.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I see.
Izumo goes back to her tasks.
Wooleep hovers behind her, chirping occasionally.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I still can't believe Izumo could be that assertive.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Did it look like she was having fun, or was it just me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I felt the same, mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Did she always have a function like that? Maybe the wipe out all those years ago created a bug in her programming?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whatever it is...
Yonagi looks at Izumo then turns back to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think I love Izumo more than ever before.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
I smile and nod back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Me too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We got one more.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A reader of your novels.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah, yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Don't you want lots of people to read what you write?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My novels, you mean?
I nod at her.
Her mouth turns into a hard line as she considers it for a moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mmm, well, I'm happy you and Izumo read them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I guess I don't really care about having other people read them, really.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm not writing for other people to read my stuff.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
I urge her to go on with my silence.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You remember back when we were kids? Don't actually answer that. You know how that one time a topsider kid broke the toy you made?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
She's talking about Shachi.
The boy who climbed up the ivy in that small clearing we found and died on top of the ozone lens.
That was the last time we saw him.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For a while after that, you cried every time you thought about what happened, remember?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That wouldn't surprise me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know you remember.
She's right, not that I would readily admit it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Being able to forget is something that helps people. That experience taught me that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know it's hard for you. But I think being able to remember the things you experienced and how you felt at the time so clearly is something impressive in its own way.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's just something I've been thinking about.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why I write my novels to represent my feelings about things I've experienced myself.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You feel that way about Sumomo's story too?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Of course! Back when we met, you seemed so much younger than me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And I was surprised to find out you liked dumpster diving.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's where I got our foul-mouthed scrap hunter!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was a joke at my expense?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! That's right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Almost all of the stories I write come from things I experienced with you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I also wanted to speak more with Mom too, I guess. Just like Kanna.
I recall Sumomo's story again.
A boy who has lost his mother meets a woman, and they spend a summer together searching for a special place that holds a deep connection to him and his mother.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And the same goes for the story about Shakespeare?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep, that's right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I'm sure I'm the only one who gets the meaning behind it right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The excitement I feel, and the frustration. I keep writing to put all those feelings to paper.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For my future self.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do you mean?
She looks up at me and smiles.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What I said! I'm writing so I can remember how I felt when I was young even when I become a wrinkly old lady.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Memories usually fade over time, but if I can make stories that let me reconnect with the feelings I had back then, they won't ever really fade.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, makes sense.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's why it's enough for me if only you and Izumo read them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're the only people who I want to know me better.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I promise to keep reading them together with you even when I become a wrinkly old man.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm sure we'll be living in the middle side by then.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Middle side?
I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If this emulator works as I intend, it'll become a huge success for Asuma's lab.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Then he'll be able to put in a request for me to be a full-time researcher. I'll be a real researcher.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Which means we'd move to the middle side.
She listens attentively, her eyes wide open.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see...
Her voice lowers to a murmur as she slowly lets her gaze wander about the room.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But you know...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I like our house a lot.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll keep helping so your research goes well, of course!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks.
I know where she's coming from.
This house is full of memories with Mom.
But...
We can't live off memories forever.
Cherishing our memories together isn't the same as clinging on to the past.
I shake my head to chase the thoughts away.
There's no point in worrying about it before I've even produced any results.
Iruma's a researcher already.
I turn my terminal on and start going through the data we got with Izumo today.
The next day, Professor Asuma and I pour ourselves plenty of coffee and discuss theories all day. It's become kind of a routine for us.
I use the time to give him a brief progress report on my work.
I tell him about some of my findings.
Like how the different parts of the brain are stimulated depending on the nature of the virtual space.
He listens to me intently, sometimes interjecting with questions of his own.
Before long, we've finished the first cup of coffee.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: May I ask something?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Please.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: You were studying the human brain before coming here, is that right?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Any reason in particular for it? It struck me as a little too specific to be a general subject of research.
That question takes me back to the first time Yonagi ever took me to the library, and I ended up reading medical books.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose it had something to do with my mother's illness.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Illness? Don't you live with your parents?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No. Both of them passed away.
He raises his eyebrows slightly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If we had been midsiders, maybe they could have gotten cellular improvements to help their conditions.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But we didn't have that option, so I started studying the human body to find a solution.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How old was your mother?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She passed away when she was thirty.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: So young...
I look up at him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um, I don't know if it's okay to ask, but...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: How old am I? I'll be seventy-two this year.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Midsiders really do stay young, huh?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I take artificial genes, amino acids, and nanomachine pills daily.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We can use the genetic information gathered by our chips to send artificial genes to specific cells and switch them. Nowadays, people believe aging to be a sign of laziness for the most part.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: All midsiders do that?
He nods in response.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Before the normalization of artificial genes, the average life expectancy of humans was about eighty years. Half of what it is now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Eighty? So it was shorter than the life expectancy of lowsiders today?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We had more resources to draw from when we were on the surface. The scale of research and manufacturing should have been leagues above whatever we can muster up.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In fact, the invention of artificial genes created a market. At first, only the wealthy had the money to spare on prolonging their lives, but it eventually became available in less developed countries.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So even people like today's lowsiders had access to it?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Most of those cheaper solutions did not contain nanomachines.Without them, there was no feedback from the body, and the gene rewriting came out incomplete more often than not.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But it still led to prolonging life to some extent, so the artificial genes ended up spreading like wildfire all over the globe. Like a bad drug, you could say.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Even if the people in the low side aren't taking artificial genes now, there is evidence that their genes have been rewritten.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So our lifespan is longer in general as a result?
He nods again.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The inherited genes from past generations have been mutated, and people pass them down. It's evolution, really. We humans are the first species on the planet to evolve ourselves through our own inventions.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It sounds like we're paying for our folly sometimes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: And you wouldn't be far from the truth.
After that, he gets up from his chair with his mug in hand.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Let's take a break. I'll prepare the next batch of coffee, if that's okay.
The professor moseys over to the sink, two mugs in hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hello!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Welcome home, handsome!
Yonagi rushes over to me as I open the door, her smile more radiant than usual.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Did something good happen?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You gotta hear this! I got Izumo to memorize a bunch of characters!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's the best! Izumo's the best actress ever! You wanna see it? Of course you do! Right?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: S-Sure.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Should I put dinner preparations on hold?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, forget about food! We're going to Tenbridge today!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ta-dah!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And this place is?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: William Shakespeare's family business!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And this is—drumroll, please—the owner of this fine establishment! John Shakespeare!

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: Ah, that'd be me. Good day to you, lad.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? Is that Izumo?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Exacto!

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: I could go for some porridge, yes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: Where's the ale?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is he supposed to be this... mercurial?

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: A drop of ale for my kingdom.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Not a very upstanding man, I suppose.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And there's even more!
Yonagi excitedly turns to the old man.
Well, it's still Izumo... allegedly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do Spencer now, would you kindly?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wh-Who?!

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: The nombre is Spencer, and don't you forget it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're getting him confused with Azuki!

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: Hola, my chico.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Again, who?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The bad guy who made Olivia his servant!

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: I could go for some porridge, yes sir.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: They share lines?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aw, you joker! Nobles don't eat porridge.

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: I live by my own reglas. I am not bound by such petty notions of sentido comun.

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: The only momento to bind and to be bound is on top of a bed, I reckon.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You came up with this?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Uh, no?!

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: Many miembros of the aristocracy reveled in debauchery and excess. Especially so when it came to matters of sensualidad.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Really?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I suppose that's true in every era.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why is he speaking in Spanish, though?

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: Why, it is such a robusto and challenging language, and I do love myself stiff and towering challenges. Ah, how I love to grind myself against such endeavors, much how I love grinding up on a good chico's little amigo, yes.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo?!
Is that Izumo speaking right now? Does she like... grinding things up?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Who's that?!

texts.name: Kiki (Izumo)
texts.text: I'm Kiki, remember? I'm a member of Olivia's troupe.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What? You made her, Izumo?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's pretty cute.

texts.name: Kiki (Izumo)
texts.text: Eheheh!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No, wait! That won't work! There can't be any actress other than Olivia in this world!

texts.name: Kiki (Izumo)
texts.text: Oh, but I'm a boy? I have a dingle dangle and all.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you jesting?!

texts.name: Kiki (Izumo)
texts.text: Nah! Wanna cop a feel?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: N-No, thank you!

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: Why, I think I'll take you up on that offer, then.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo! S-Stop improvising!

texts.name: Father (Izumo)
texts.text: Ah, you're right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: IZUMOOOOOO!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And all hell broke loose.

texts.name: Spencer (Izumo)
texts.text: Ah, how I would simplemente love to peck at it. Like a small, delicate bird.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Where is this going?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I-Izumo! Don't you think we might be going a little overboard with the dingle jokes?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Data of the time period suggests that a moderate amount of off-color humor was indispensable in works designed for the entertainment of the masses.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That was moderate to you?! Are you sure?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? But these are characters you made, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Izumo came up with all that on her own, okay?! I didn't write any of it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hell's truly loose today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What is that supposed to mean?! You're gonna tick me off!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: I will now prepare the porridge.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You want us to eat porridge after THAT?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Izumo, before you do that, please send the data from just now.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Displaying now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, Yonagi's heart rate skyrocketed back there. This is good data to have.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Well done, Izumo. Feel free to deviate from the script if you must.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: As was my intention.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Does anyone listen to anything I say in this stupid house?! I must scream!
